UserGroup.title: UserGroup
UserGroup.description: Represents a group of users within the family cookbook application, where members share recipes and other content.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user group.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account within the family cookbook application.

userGroupId.description: Reference to the UserGroup this user belongs to. (Relationship: UserGroup 1:N User)

Recipe.title: Recipe
Recipe.description: Represents a recipe within the family cookbook application.

source.description: Source of the recipe (e.g., family member, cookbook).

prepTime.description: The prep time for the recipe.

cookTime.description: The cook time for the recipe.

totalTime.description: Total time needed for the recipe.

servings.description: Number of servings the recipe makes.

freezable.description: Indicates whether the recipe is suitable for freezing.

userGroupId.description: Reference to the UserGroup this recipe belongs to. (Relationship: UserGroup 1:N Recipe)

userId.description: Reference to the User who created this recipe. (Relationship: User 1:N Recipe)

Ingredient.title: Ingredient
Ingredient.description: Represents an ingredient used in a recipe.

RecipeIngredient.title: RecipeIngredient
RecipeIngredient.description: Represents the relationship between a recipe and its ingredients, including the amount needed.

id.description: Unique identifier for the RecipeIngredient entry.

recipeId.description: Reference to the Recipe. (Relationship: Recipe 1:N RecipeIngredient)

ingredientId.description: Reference to the Ingredient. (Relationship: Ingredient 1:N RecipeIngredient)

amount.description: Amount of the ingredient needed for the recipe.

unit.description: Unit of measurement for the ingredient amount (e.g., cup, tbsp).

ShoppingList.title: ShoppingList
ShoppingList.description: Represents a shopping list for a user group.

id.description: Unique identifier for the shopping list.

userGroupId.description: Reference to the UserGroup this shopping list belongs to. (Relationship: UserGroup 1:N ShoppingList)

userId.description: Reference to the User who created this shopping list. (Relationship: User 1:N ShoppingList)

ShoppingListItem.title: ShoppingListItem
ShoppingListItem.description: Represents an item on a shopping list.

id.description: Unique identifier for the shopping list item.

shoppingListId.description: Reference to the ShoppingList. (Relationship: ShoppingList 1:N ShoppingListItem)

ingredientId.description: Reference to the Ingredient. (Relationship: Ingredient 1:N ShoppingListItem)

unit.description: Unit of measurement for the ingredient amount (e.g., cup, tbsp).

recipeId.description: Reference to the Recipe this ingredient is for (optional). (Relationship: Recipe 1:N ShoppingListItem)

RecipeView.title: RecipeView
RecipeView.description: Stores information about recipe views by guest users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the RecipeView entry.

recipeId.description: Reference to the Recipe being viewed. (Relationship: Recipe 1:N RecipeView)

viewedAt.description: Timestamp of when the recipe was viewed.

guestIdentifier.description: Unique identifier for the guest user (e.g., IP address, session ID).

ActivityLog.title: ActivityLog
ActivityLog.description: Logs user activities within the application, such as adding or editing recipes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the activity log entry.

userId.description: Reference to the User performing the action. (Relationship: User 1:N ActivityLog)

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the activity occurred.

actionType.description: Type of action performed (e.g., addRecipe, editRecipe, addToShoppingList).

recipeId.description: Reference to the Recipe involved in the activity (if applicable). (Relationship: Recipe 1:N ActivityLog)

shoppingListId.description: Reference to the ShoppingList involved in the activity (if applicable). (Relationship: ShoppingList 1:N ActivityLog)

firestore.reasoning:
This design prioritizes security and scalability for the Family Cookbook application. User data and group affiliations are explicitly stored to avoid complex security rules that rely on hierarchical `get()` calls. This ensures Authorization Independence, crucial for atomic operations and debuggability. The use of path-based ownership and membership maps facilitates simple and robust security rules. Segregation of user groups into separate subcollections provides a homogeneous security posture for each group.

Key design choices and justifications:

*   **/user_groups/{userGroupId}:** Each group is a top-level document. This allows for easy management of group-level settings and data. Management is restricted to a super-admin.
*   **/user_groups/{userGroupId}/users/{userId}:**  Users are stored as subcollections of their respective groups. This enforces group-level access control and simplifies user management within a group.
*   **/user_groups/{userGroupId}/recipes/{recipeId}:** Recipes are stored as subcollections of user groups. This ensures that recipes are only accessible to members of the group. The `userId` field indicates the creator of the recipe.
*   **/user_groups/{userGroupId}/shopping_lists/{shoppingListId}:** Shopping lists are stored as subcollections of user groups, making them accessible only to group members. Each shopping list has a `userId` to track its creator.
*   **/user_groups/{userGroupId}/shopping_lists/{shoppingListId}/items/{itemId}:** Shopping list items are stored as subcollections, maintaining a clear hierarchy.
*   **/recipe_views/{recipeViewId}:** This collection stores recipe view events, which can be used to track guest access and analytics. Note: this collection lives separately from the user group data because it's intended for broader tracking/analytics and guest access, and it should not be governed by the same security rules as the group-specific content.
*   **/activity_logs/{activityLogId}:** This top-level collection stores activity logs. It avoids storing activity logs as a subcollection of a group to facilitate centralized monitoring and auditing across all groups. This separation ensures that activity logs are not inadvertently deleted or restricted by group-specific security rules.

**Authorization Independence (CRITICAL):** Denormalization is used to avoid `get()` calls in security rules. For example, the `recipes` subcollection of a `user_group` does *not* need to `get()` the parent `user_group` to determine authorization.  Instead, the rules can directly evaluate `request.auth.uid` against the `userId` property on the `recipe`. Similarly, recipes shown via guest access are handled via the separate `recipe_views` collection, bypassing group security constraints. All collections assume authentication relies solely on `request.auth.uid` or the existence of an anonymous auth token.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

*   **List Operations:** The structure supports secure `list` operations because data is segregated by user group. Rules can allow listing recipes within a specific group based on the user's membership in that group, without the need to filter based on data content.
*   **Guest Access:** The separate `recipe_views` collection and corresponding rules allow for controlled access to individual recipes via a unique link without affecting group security. This mechanism enables secure listing of public/shared recipes while protecting group-private content.
*   **Admin Role:** The super-admin role, enforced via custom claims, allows a single user to manage all groups and users across the application.
